page.title: 01Pocklington Survey Summary
page.content: We interviewed 70 people from Pocklington and the following is a summary of some of their views of the area: Most interviewees were local or had lived in the area for at least 30 years, most were retired, housewives or manual workers. Semi-detached and detached townhouses were the most popular dwellings. The main advantages of living in the area were easy access to shops, the city of York and peaceful attractive countryside. Disadvantages were high unemployment, inadequate entertainment road cleansing and public transport. Most people were satisfied with the following facilities: shopping, health and medical care, education, housing, police and emergency services. Most were dissatisfied with the employment prospects and public transport.
